instruction: You are given a dialog between 2 or more individuals. Within the dialog, there will be clues as to the names of the speakers. You will be asked at the end of the dialog to identify the name of one of the speakers.
input:
Speaker 1: All right, I'll see you guys later. 
Speaker 2: Off to see young Ethan? 
Speaker 1: Thank you. 
Speaker 3: How young is young Ethan? Young? 
Speaker 1: He's... our age. 
Speaker 4: When we were? 
Speaker 1: Okay, he's a senior in college. 
Speaker 5: College? 
Speaker 4: Whoa! And this manchild has no problem with how old you are? 
Speaker 1: No, of course not. It's not even an issue. Cause I told him I was 22. 
Speaker 6: What? 
Speaker 1: Oh, I can't pass for 22? 
Speaker 7: Well, maybe 25-26. 
Speaker 1: I am 26. 
Speaker 7: There you go. 
Speaker 1: Windows are clean, candels are lit. Uh, belt's to tight, gotta change the belt. Did I turn the fish? No, cause I made lasagne. Am I out of control? 
Speaker 2: Just a touch. Mon, I don't understand. I mean, you've been dating this guy since like, what... his midterms? I mean, why all the sudden are you so... Oh. 
Speaker 1: What? 
Speaker 2: Could tonight be the Night? 
Speaker 1: I don't know. Look he's a great guy and I love being with him but... you know. Things happen, and they happen. You don't plan these things. 
Speaker 2: So, did you shave your legs? 
Speaker 1: Yeah. 
Speaker 2: A-ha! What is the name or nickname of 
Speaker 1?

instruction: You are given a dialog between 2 or more individuals. Within the dialog, there will be clues as to the names of the speakers. You will be asked at the end of the dialog to identify the name of one of the speakers.
input:
Speaker 1: Julie hi! Chandler Bing, I, I guess you remember me. 
Speaker 2: Hello Skidmark. 
Speaker 1: It's a nickname, I'll explain later. 
Speaker 3: It's pretty clear. 
Speaker 1: Ah, uh, I owe you a long overdue apology. I never should have broken up with you because you were overweight. 
Speaker 2: That's why you broke up with me? 
Speaker 1: You-you-you didn't know that. Well, I guess my work here is done! What is the name or nickname of 
Speaker 1?

instruction: You are given a dialog between 2 or more individuals. Within the dialog, there will be clues as to the names of the speakers. You will be asked at the end of the dialog to identify the name of one of the speakers.
input:
Speaker 1: Hey, listen Rach. Thanks again for coming down to watch my scenes! 
Speaker 2: Oh, please! Honey, just the fact that you want me here to support you, I'm... OH MY GOD! Is that Christian Sanders? He's so gorgeous! 
Speaker 1: Also so gay! 
Speaker 2: Oh, in my head he's done some pretty "not-gay-stuff"! 
Speaker 1: Well, at the Christmas party him and Santa did some definitely gay stuff! 
Speaker 3: Joey, Joey! We're ready for you! 
Speaker 1: Oh, wish me luck! 
Speaker 2: Ok, not that you need it but good... GOD! Is that Chase Lassiter? He's straight, right? 
Speaker 1: Rach, I gotta say... if you weren't here wondering if these guys were gay I don't know if I could do this! 
Speaker 2: Oh, I'm sorry, you're right. I'm sorry, good luck! What is the name or nickname of 
Speaker 2?

instruction: You are given a dialog between 2 or more individuals. Within the dialog, there will be clues as to the names of the speakers. You will be asked at the end of the dialog to identify the name of one of the speakers.
input:
Speaker 1: Rach? Hi! 
Speaker 2: Hi! 
Speaker 1: Did you tell your sister to ask me out? 
Speaker 2: Well yeah... 
Speaker 1: Oh wow! I mean, wow! I mean, I-I-I think she's cute but I-I would never have thought of going out with her, never! 
Speaker 2: Really?! 
Speaker 1: Yeah but after you said it was okay, I figured, "Why not?!" 
Speaker 2: Oh so-so not really never. 
Speaker 1: I have to say you are a much bigger person than I am. I mean after all we've been through, I just-y'know I wish I had a brother to reciprocate. Hey, if you ever want to go out with Monica, you have my blessing. 
Speaker 3: Oh-ho, and mine! What is the name or nickname of 
Speaker 2?
